5.  [More Vegan Smoothie Recipes](#h-more-vegan-smoothie-recipes "More Vegan Smoothie Recipes")
    

Whatâ€™s A Matcha Smoothie?
-------------------------

Matcha powder is a source of powerful antioxidants and caffeine and a great swap to morning coffee.

If you donâ€™t feel like a warm [Matcha latte](https://www.theconsciousplantkitchen.com/vegan-matcha-latte/) this morning, try this easy Matcha smoothie instead.

Itâ€™s packed with all the healthy protein, fat, and vitamins you need to start with energy.

How To Make Matcha Avocado Smoothie
-----------------------------------

All you need to make this healthy Matcha powder smoothie recipe are a few simple ingredients.

### Ingredients

*   **Matcha powder** â€“ use a high-quality green tea powder for the best flavor.
*   **Banana** â€“ a yellow banana, not overripe.
*   **Avocado** â€“ use a ripe avocado with no black spots on the flesh. If your avocado shows black spots, itâ€™s overripe, and it will add a bitter flavor to your drink.
*   **Unsweetened almond milk** â€“ or any plant-based milk you love.
*   **Ice cubes** â€“ this adds a frothy, thick creamy texture to this banana Matcha smoothie. Another option is to use frozen bananas in this recipe so you wonâ€™t need ice cubes.
*   **Sweetener** â€“ this is optional, but if you have a sweet tooth, you can add a few teaspoons of maple syrup or a few stevia drops to boost the sweetness of your drink.

### Blending

Next, add all the ingredients to the blender, starting with almond milk to make it easier to blend.

Blend on high speed until creamy and smooth.

![How to make avocado matcha smoothie](https://www.theconsciousplantkitchen.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/How-to-make-avocado-matcha-smoothie.jpg)

### Taste and adjust

We all have different tastes, and itâ€™s even more true when it comes to Matcha powder.

Some people love a strong Matcha flavor in their drink, while others like it light and subtle.

This is the same with sweetness and frothy texture.

Thatâ€™s why I always recommend trying your Matcha banana smoothie before serving.

So if it is not sweet, frothy, or flavorsome enough, you have time to adjust and blend again before serving.

### Serving

You can serve this avocado Matcha smoothie with a dollop of my whipped coconut cream recipe, a drizzle of melted chocolate, and extra dust of Matcha powder.

Matcha, coconut, and chocolate are made to go together, and your smoothie will taste like a real treat, similar to ice cream!

![Matcha green smoothie with avocado](https://www.theconsciousplantkitchen.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/Matcha-green-smoothie-with-avocado.jpg)

Frequently Asked Questions
--------------------------

### Can I Make Matcha Smoothie Thicker?

Below I listed several tips to increase the creamy thick texture of this simple Matcha smoothie recipe.

*   **Frozen fruits** â€“ this recipe calls for a banana, so swap this with frozen banana slices. The day before making the recipe, peel, slice the bananas, and freeze them in an airtight container. Use the frozen banana slices in the smoothie the next day.
*   **Frozen cauliflower rice** â€“ yes, you are reading well. This is a healthy option to add a creamy texture to smoothies and a boost of vegetables too. Swap the ice cubes with frozen cauliflower rice. If you are on a vegan keto diet, it is a great option to replace bananas in smoothies and still maintain a creamy thick texture. You will be surprised by how good it tastes.
*   **Cashews** â€“ add a few raw cashews to the blender for a wonderful flavor and extra creamy texture.
*   **Dates** â€“ this changes the color of the green smoothie to brownish color, but it adds a delicious sweet flavor and thick texture to smoothies.
*   **Avocado**

Storage Instructions
--------------------

This smoothie doesnâ€™t store well in the fridge because it contains avocado. In fact, avocado turns to a brownish color with time and develops a bitter flavor.

However, you can freeze your smoothie into popsicle molds and make delicious Matcha avocado popsicles like [my avocado popsicle recipe here.](https://www.theconsciousplantkitchen.com/avocado-popsicles/)

# Matcha Coconut Muffins - Choosing Chia
_These Matcha Coconut Muffins are packed with matcha flavour and are perfectly light and fluffy. Enjoy them for breakfast, a snack or a little treat. No mixer required and ready in just 30 minutes!_

![matcha coconut muffins on a marble counter with a jar of milk](https://choosingchia.com/jessh-jessh/uploads/2021/04/Matcha-Coconut-Muffins-7-680x1020.jpg)

What is Matcha?
---------------

**Matcha is a premium green tea that is sourced from Japan**. Itâ€™s made by grinding the actual green tea leaves into a fine powder.

You can then use this powder to make a tea, [latte](https://choosingchia.com/vanilla-macadamia-matcha-latte/), or use it in baking. Matcha contains nutrients from the entire leaf and has a higher amount of caffeine and antioxidants than traditional green tea.

Baking with Matcha tea
----------------------

There are different grades of Matcha green tea, and different qualities as well. The two grades of matcha are culinary grade and ceremonial grade. Ceremonial grade matcha is made for drinking. Itâ€™s made from the youngest tea leaves and has a more delicate and sweet flavour.

**Culinary grade matcha on the other hand tends to have a stronger and slightly more bitter taste**. Itâ€™s not â€œlow-qualityâ€ just not as high quality as ceremonial grade matcha, which makes it perfect to use in recipes.

For baking, you want to use culinary-grade matcha. (You can technically use a ceremonial grade, but itâ€™s just not necessary and wonâ€™t make the recipe any better.)

How to make this recipe
-----------------------

Mix the dry ingredients together in a bowl and the wet ingredients together in another bowl.

*   ![a bowl of flour and matcha powder](https://choosingchia.com/jessh-jessh/uploads/2021/04/Matcha-Coconut-Muffins-1-680x1020.jpg)
    
*   ![Coconut milk in a clear mixing bowl with a whisk](https://choosingchia.com/jessh-jessh/uploads/2021/04/Matcha-Coconut-Muffins-2-680x1020.jpg)
    

Mix the dry and wet ingredients together just until combined. You donâ€™t want to over-mix the batter. Then spoon the batter into a muffin pan filling 2-3 of the way full and top with coconut flakes.

*   ![matcha muffin batter in a bowl](https://choosingchia.com/jessh-jessh/uploads/2021/04/Matcha-Coconut-Muffins-3-680x1020.jpg)
    
*   ![unbaked matcha muffins in a baking pan](https://choosingchia.com/jessh-jessh/uploads/2021/04/Matcha-Coconut-Muffins-4-680x1020.jpg)
    

Bake the muffins in at 350 degrees F for 20-25 minutes. Let them cool before digging in!

*   ![baked matcha muffins topped with coconut in a muffin pan](https://choosingchia.com/jessh-jessh/uploads/2021/04/Matcha-Coconut-Muffins-5-680x1020.jpg)
    
*   ![matcha coconut muffins with 2 jars of milk in the back](https://choosingchia.com/jessh-jessh/uploads/2021/04/Matcha-Coconut-Muffins-8-680x1020.jpg)
    

Tips for making this recipe perfectly
-------------------------------------

*   Use a good quality culinary grade matcha to make these matcha muffins. The colour of the matcha should be a rich vibrant green.
*   While you can use a whole grain flour, (or a mix of half white and half whole grain) keep in mind this may alter the final colour of the muffins.
*   Let the coconut oil cool completely before mixing it with the egg. Otherwise, the heat from the coconut oil will cook the egg.
*   Use full-fat coconut milk from a can for best results.

* * *

### Description

Matcha Coconut Muffins are light, fluffy and packed with matcha flavour! Enjoy these for breakfast, a snack or a treat.Â 

* * *

*   1 3/4 cups all purpose flour
*   1/4 cup shredded unsweetened coconut
*   1/2 cup cane sugar
*   1 tbsp baking powder
*   1/4 tsp salt
*   1 1/2 tbsp matcha powder
*   1 cup+2 tbsp [coconut milk](http://l.thrv.me/cc-native-forest-org-coco-milk) (from a can)
*   1/4 cup [coconut oil](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00DS842HS/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=choosingchia-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00DS842HS&linkId=5c53f6cde44b7f964e3f8e49d5952b8e) , melted and cooled
*   1 large egg
*   2 tsp [vanilla extract](http://l.thrv.me/cc-simply-org-vanilla-extract)
*   Coconut flakes to top

Cook Mode Prevent your screen from going dark

* * *

1.  Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a [muffin pan](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001IANICS/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=choosingchia-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B001IANICS&linkId=37c16ccc24dc887544be99683fab22d5) with liners
2.  Sift the flour into a bowl, then add the shredded coconut, sugar, baking powder, salt and matcha powder
3.  In a separate bowl, [whisk](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08KWN6BL2/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=choosingchia-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B08KWN6BL2&linkId=6eec609e2175b6f95dfa7bb9d4008989) together the [coconut milk](http://l.thrv.me/cc-native-forest-org-coco-milk), [coconut oil](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00DS842HS/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=choosingchia-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00DS842HS&linkId=5c53f6cde44b7f964e3f8e49d5952b8e), egg and [vanilla extract](http://l.thrv.me/cc-simply-org-vanilla-extract)
4.  Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix just until combined. Donâ€™t overmix.Â 
5.  Spoon the batter into a [muffin pan](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001IANICS/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=choosingchia-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B001IANICS&linkId=37c16ccc24dc887544be99683fab22d5) filling 2/3 of the way full.
6.  Top with coconut flakes and bake for 20-23 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.Â 

* * *

### Notes

Use a good quality culinary grade matcha to make these matcha muffins. The colour of the matcha should be a rich vibrant green.

Make sure the tbsp of baking powder is level when measured.Â 

While you can use whole grain flour, (or a mix of half white and half whole grain) keep in mind this may alter the final colour of the muffins.

Let the [coconut oil](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00DS842HS/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=choosingchia-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00DS842HS&linkId=5c53f6cde44b7f964e3f8e49d5952b8e) cool completely before mixing it with the egg. Otherwise, the heat from the [coconut oil](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00DS842HS/ref=as_li_qf_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=choosingchia-20&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00DS842HS&linkId=5c53f6cde44b7f964e3f8e49d5952b8e) will cook the egg.

Use full-fat [coconut milk](http://l.thrv.me/cc-native-forest-org-coco-milk) from a can for best results.
